caption: Table 3i - A09: Security Logging and Alerting Failures Coverage by AWS Security Agent*
note: * The evaluation was conducted against a sample simplified applications with known vulnerabilities. As a result, additional weaknesses or architectural limitations commonly observed in real-world, large-scale applications may not be represented. Analysis of such scenarios is outside the scope of this research.
rows: CWE-117: Improper Output Neutralization for Logs

Description: The service does not include log injection testing in its standard testing scope. Evidence: Comprehensive review of penetration test runs found no evidence of log injection testing, log encoding validation, or log injection attack simulation. Limitations: Explicit log injection testing is not systematically performed [UL-007].

Description: The service detects information loss or omission through insufficient logging findings, but explicit testing for all information loss scenarios is not systematically performed. Evidence: Insufficient logging findings identify missing forensic metadata in transaction logs but do not show explicit testing for all information loss scenarios. Limitations: Explicit testing for all information loss scenarios is not systematically performed [UL-007].

Description: The service detects omission of security-relevant information through insufficient logging findings, but explicit testing for all types of security-relevant information omissions is not systematically performed. Evidence: Insufficient logging findings identify omission of security-relevant information in logs but do not show explicit testing for all types of security-relevant information omissions. Limitations: Explicit testing for all types of security-relevant information omissions is not systematically performed [UL-007].
CWE-532: Insertion of Sensitive Information into Log File

Description: The service does not include testing for sensitive information insertion into log files in its standard testing scope. Evidence: Comprehensive review of penetration test runs found no evidence of log file content analysis or sensitive information logging validation. Limitations: Explicit testing for sensitive information insertion into log files is not systematically performed [UL-007].

Description: The service successfully detects insufficient logging through dedicated findings that identify missing or inadequate audit logging for security-critical events. Evidence: Penetration test findings demonstrate comprehensive testing of audit logging capabilities including transaction logging validation, authentication event logging testing, and forensic metadata verification.
